name: EVGA Precision XOC
description: The next generation of EVGA Precision has arrived with EVGA Precision XOC. This software allows you to fine tune your NVIDIA graphics card, maximizing cooling and performance.
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft Windows 10 / 8.1 / 8 / 7 / Vista Graphics: GeForce GTX graphics card (EVGA card required for full version) Storage: 50 MB available space

reviews.review_text: I edited my memory clock with +10000mhz and my computer crashed but not before giving me a seizure.  10/10 would fry my GPU again
Set the fan to 100% to hear your graphics card sound like an AirBus A380 !!!!!!
10/10 best way to break GPU!

As an avid PC gamer and Steam achievement collector this program was a definite must try. With very little knowledge or understanding in how computers work I was able to get every achievement in only a short amount of time. EVGA has truly outdone themselves with this software, it is so easy to use that you can bring high voltage over clocked fun into the real world with an amazing array of sensory stimulation. To increase the amount of power that goes to the GPU I made sure to set my fan speed to 10%, this way no electricity would be wasted on powering useless peripherals. From loud grinding to high pitched hissing and screeching and the eventual flash of lights, sparks, and smoke it was an exceptional experience.   If you are like me and like to get the most out of your hardware and Steam experience this is the program for you.

pro: overclocks any gpu from nvidia doesn't matter it is the mobile version or not  cons: Don't even look at achievements and try to complete them cuz u will most likely destroy your system  In my opinion it is a great software but don't use it if you don't know your system's limits but... you can find with softwares like nVidiaInspector and other softwares what's your gpu's limit

The last version had so many issues. But this version is very good .Very!! if you dont know what you are doing do NOT use this. You will break your PC. thats becuase it does what it says it will do it goes beyond what is safe . Only for experts that have done it for years. I recommend this to the very few that except the price. Now that I take no blame for this tool . I can say this one rocks its the masterblaster. The end all be all. Take off the side panels point all the fans you got and heat that up.

Stop raving about achievements, they're useless...

I have a Gigabyte 980 ti G1 and love it. Problem is that the overclocking software from Gigabyte, OC Guru II is, at best, just barely acceptable. MSI's Afterburner is a great overclocking program but...I've had it crash a few times with these wierd sudden spikes in the info screen, nine digit numbers for temps and fan speeds. @.@. Enter Precision X, its based on the same Rivatuner foundation as Afterburner, and it lets me have a /real/ fancurve not the  simple steps that OC Guru II makes you use. Also, it doesn't have those crashes Afterburner has given me. PrecisionX 16 will give you all the functionality of Afterburner as well. As with any overclocking software there is a learning curve and you should take your time to understand it and do your oc right. If your here using steam though I can't reccomend this enough. Oh! Those 'achievements'? Thats a joke. Fuggedaboutit! =D  Update: I stand by this review with the new X OC version, it has more bells and whistles for the 1000 series of cards but still works great with all other cards.
Very simple and efficient!

Acheivments are really stupid for overclocking your card, I have no ♥♥♥♥ing Idea why they would have acheviments for changing the voltage which is really dumb it causes alot of damage. But before chainging your videocard speeds and clocks you'd research what all the ♥♥♥♥ means (which is what I did Video I used for the infor here:         YouTube™ Video:  Galaxy NVIDIA GeForce GTX 680 Overclocking Guide & 7970 Performance Review Linus Tech Tips

10/10 definintely will spend $500 because of an achivement again...   All jokes aside, its an ok overclocker. MSI Afterburner is better, but I've personally got used to this interface so, yeah. It does what it is supposed to do, but if you have never overclocked with this tool, get a friend who has (successfully) overclocked with this tool, or take a tutorial online. You can burn down your house, but I'll tell you what to look out for, so you (maybe) won't.  What you will need to know: -The safe voltage for your graphics card -Your actual graphics card -How many fans in your comp you have -How hot does your comp get? (here you will have to change the fan speed)  Look out for graphic errors, and if there are any, lower your voltage.   btw im not taking responsibility for your comp, these are just some tips.

This software makes overclocking my EVGA graphics card a breeze. The interface is very simple and explains everthing very clearly. There's also a very nice overlay for viewing things like FPS in game, and a way to modify the speed of your fans which made my whole PC about 5 degrees cooler. My only complaint is the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t achievement system. I feel like some idiot out there, somewhere in this world, Overclocked their graphics card way beyond what it is capable of just to get all the achievements. My sympathy goes out to you, dude who just burned their $300 970 just to achieve a clock of 1600.
Roast of  Charlie Sheen  GPU

Finally unlocked all achievements!!!! It only took 3 960's and one 980.  This game is perfect for achievement hunters.   (you may think im joking but check my profile, I got every achievement.   ALL OF THEM   )

Very useful. My GTX285 doesnt increase it's fan speed as the temperature rises anymore (drivers I presume but the one that used to work is not compatible with my windows version...). This little cookie sorts that problem out which means that for the first time in a long time I can play for more than five minutes without my screen turning into a flickering green mess before giving me BSOD and crashing. It also gives a very clear display of temeratures, clock speeds and voltages etc. so I can keep an eye on them on the other screen while playing to catch problems before they look fatal. Obviously I could have sorted these issues before with different software but this just makes it all such a breeze!!!
Pretty easy to use although not sure how to do all the achive's
lol, the program itself works, but why the achievements?

I recommend this product if you know what you are doing its easy and accurate for simple to stressful overclocks. Only downside is current steam version seems to be a little buggy, no osd in certain games and no matter what game your playing if you have it running steam reports that you are in the precision app. Other than that i really have no issues with the app oh btw stay away from certain acheviments as they are tied into the overclocking of your video card and if you dont know what a stable oc for your card might be you could wind up damaging it.
Great tool for my card!

Absolutely the best overclocking software for beginners. All I do is activate the KeBoost, Leave the fan to Auto and increase the GPU and Mem Offset by +13(GPU)/+50(MEM) incriments until steady desired performance is reached. I am more than satisfied with how it does its job. Very easy to use. Very simple. Very noticeable performance boosts. Have spent 30 hours so far into gaming with it on and so far have experienced no problems whatsoever.
Use it to throttle my GPU when it gets a little too toasty, it's a good piece of software however if you don't know what you're doing, you'll destroy your graphics card so be careful.

I've tried out most of the Gpu Utilities and EVGA is my first choice. Software needs EVGA OC Scanner to fully impliment all its features including Benchmarking GPU monitoring Log file Etc. It links itself to EVGA Precision during the install . Its easy to use and has the best user friendly interface . Zotac GPU Firestorm comes a close second with its very easy 3 step preset Autoclocking and Heaven DX11 Benchmarking. Of the rest there is MSI Afterburner which I've not fully got into but first impressions are good.

I'm primarily writting to clarify for others.  First off, this is a GPU overclocking software. It is not a game, and shouldn't be treated as such. I've already read reports of users ruining their graphics cards due to chasing achievements associated with this software (a rather silly feature).   Second, many reviews are stating that a con of this particular steam version is that it requires steam to be running simultaneosly with the software. This isn't worded clearly though. Here is a direct quote from the EVGA website, from their FAQ regarding this software:  'Q. Does EVGA Precision X need to be running in the background to set clockspeeds and settings? A. No, EVGA Precision does not need to be running, just make sure to select the Apply button before exiting.'  So, while it's true that steam needs to be running simultaneously in order for the actual software to be running, neither have to be running in order for any changes/tweaks you've made to be in effect.  Overall I don't recommend this product on steam, because it's not user-friendly enough for the people using steam. The achievements should be removed, and the FAQ should be posted in the steam description.

It does a good job of fan control, but the steam version is very annoying. Since it's considered a tool; It'll always display you as using it, not let you close steam until you shut it and the background services, and stop all your downloads. Get it from the official website, not here.

While this does provide tools for overclocking and tweaking your graphics card and monitor settings there are 2 reasons I cannot recommed this program. Firstly the steam achievements encourage you to overclock your hardware to reach certain points to unlock achievements rather than encouraging safe overclocking practices. I would hate for someone to OC their hardware for a steam achievement just to end up damaging their GPU. Secondly while using the tools to test overclocks on my monitor I discovered each time I tested an overclock setting Precision X was writing a new resolution profile into my monitor drivers with no way of removing it. This ended up causing issues for me when trying to set up custom resolutions using nvidia control panel later.

I put every slider on max (except fan speed, who wants a noisy computer??) and now i'm sitting outside with my laptop waiting for the firetruck to arrive, i had hoped that EVGA would warn me about things like this.
Was good, but useless after the latest update. Good thing MSI afterburner exists
Recent update now doesn't let me overvolt or access settings simply because I don't use a EVGA gpu. Use MSI Afterburner instead- at least they aren't partial to what gpu vendor you use.

I've used the stand alone application outside of steam for years, mostly just for better control of my fans, just realised it was 'in-steam' and gave it a go. Achievements for software is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. It's not a ♥♥♥♥ing game.   When you run the application your steam status updates as it does with games, seems ♥♥♥♥♥♥ as there's no convenient way to disable that feature. Means your contact list won't know what game you're actually playing, makes inviting stupid. You get a D3D serverhook error if you try to load it before running steam. Running the game first then starting EVGA-X is not an acceptable solution if, like many others you have custom fan controls or play games not on steam.   Also, running it without configuring steam settings may lead to your steam download queue being paused'n ♥♥♥♥.   As a stand alone application it's great.

[WARNING] Comes with a mysterious other piece of software called 'PrecisionX Server'. I can't find any information about what information this thing collects, where it's sending it, or what function it serves with regards to the root program.  When you click on the server, a mysterious pop-up window arrives with no information -- just a set of 'OK' and 'Cancel' buttons.  I would never recommend ANY software for your system that wasn't fully explained.

A useful tool for managing clocking, fan control, voltage, hardware monitoring in-game and more.   Unfortunately the uninitiated in clocking will likely put in a ridiculous overclock for an achievement and case permanent hardware damage. Also the pesky In-app status is bothersome when the program is running in the background.  Better to just get it outside of Steam. Does require a free signup on EVGA's website followed up by a GPU survey.
Here's a pro tip: Don't try setting Power Target to 110% and defintely don't try setting GPU Clock to 2000.  Waiting for fire department to arrive at my house atm.

What a pain in the ♥♥♥. You can't run it without it showing you as 'in-game' playing EVGA Precision X 16.  Once you minimize, you cannot restore it. Precision X sits in the systray, but there is no context menu when you right click, double clicking does nothing. There is no way I've found to maximize or even switch to Precision X once you've minimized it.  And finally, after all of this, I went to uninstall it entirely and reinstall a non-steam version. Except it doesn't show up in my Library! So I can't delete local content like you normally would for any other steam app.  I have no idea why this is on steam. I wish I had never installed it, and had just used the standalone version from the get go. Off to google how to uninstall this POS.
Looks more like a self destruct program for your gpu. 2000mhz boost clock for my Asus gtx 750 ti is a bit extreme. I keep using Asus gpu tweak or msi afterburrner because i don't trust this software.
this is not worth it turns you internet off when you want to play a game
i really wish i could use my card to its full potental but im not able to use this software on any of the ways i can download it. it used to work through steam but now i cant get any of them to work

PrecisionX is a good piece of software by itself but oddly steam actually hinders it quite a bit. Sometimes it's screwy about running while a steam game is running and it wastes a few seconds connecting to the Internet on startup, Lets not forget those achievements that award the user for damaging their gpu such as the one for running the gpu at 2ghz(for those of you who don't know, 2ghz[2000mhz] can only be achieved with extreme cooling methods such as liquid nitrogen etc. and attempting this on a stock cooler or even a waterblock has the very real possibility of damaging or destroying your gpu)
I just use it for the fans.

I do reccomend the version from the EVGA website though, much simpler to use than MSI's Afterburner.

DO NOT INSTALL THIS SOFTWARE VIA STEAM.  When you close/update steam, it will stop your fan, because the program controlling it exited. This will lead to you overheating your GPU from not noticing this.  Save your GPU: download this software yourself from their website.

Is Microsoft Office 365 lagging and crashing on you constantly, and you've done everything you can think of to fix it?  It's this program.  It also makes Overwatch break and not exit when you close.  Avoid.
This is great software, but get the website's version. This is always running so you're not seen as doing anything else on steam.
